1: <sup>1</sup> And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
2: <sup>2</sup> Speak unto all the congregation of the children of Israel, and say unto them, Ye shall be holy: for I the LORD your God am holy.
3: <sup>3</sup> Ye shall fear every man his mother, and his father, and keep my sabbaths: I am the LORD your God.
4: <sup>4</sup> Turn ye not unto idols, nor make to yourselves molten gods: I am the LORD your God.
5: <sup>5</sup> And if ye offer a sacrifice of peace offerings unto the LORD, ye shall offer it at your own will.
6: <sup>6</sup> It shall be eaten the same day ye offer it, and on the morrow: and if ought remain until the third day, it shall be burnt in the fire.
7: <sup>7</sup> And if it be eaten at all on the third day, it is abominable; it shall not be accepted.
8: <sup>8</sup> Therefore every one that eateth it shall bear his iniquity, because he hath profaned the hallowed thing of the LORD: and that soul shall be cut off from among his people.
9: <sup>9</sup> And when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not wholly reap the corners of thy field, neither shalt thou gather the gleanings of thy harvest.
10: <sup>10</sup> And thou shalt not glean thy vineyard, neither shalt thou gather every grape of thy vineyard; thou shalt leave them for the poor and stranger: I am the LORD your God.
11: <sup>11</sup> Ye shall not steal, neither deal falsely, neither lie one to another.
12: <sup>12</sup> And ye shall not swear by my name falsely, neither shalt thou profane the name of thy God: I am the LORD.
13: <sup>13</sup> Thou shalt not defraud thy neighbour, neither rob him: the wages of him that is hired shall not abide with thee all night until the morning.
14: <sup>14</sup> Thou shalt not curse the deaf, nor put a stumblingblock before the blind, but shalt fear thy God: I am the LORD.
15: <sup>15</sup> Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment: thou shalt not respect the person of the poor, nor honor the person of the mighty: but in righteousness shalt thou judge thy neighbour.
16: <sup>16</sup> Thou shalt not go up and down as a talebearer among thy people: neither shalt thou stand against the blood of thy neighbour; I am the LORD.
17: <sup>17</sup> Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thine heart: thou shalt in any wise rebuke thy neighbour, and not suffer sin upon him.
18: <sup>18</sup> Thou shalt not avenge, nor bear any grudge against the children of thy people, but thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself: I am the LORD.
19: <sup>19</sup> Ye shall keep my statutes. Thou shalt not let thy cattle gender with a diverse kind: thou shalt not sow thy field with mingled seed: neither shall a garment mingled of linen and woollen come upon thee.
20: <sup>20</sup> And whosoever lieth carnally with a woman, that is a bondmaid, betrothed to an husband, and not at all redeemed, nor freedom given her; she shall be scourged; they shall not be put to death, because she was not free.
21: <sup>21</sup> And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the LORD, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, even a ram for a trespass offering.
22: <sup>22</sup> And the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering before the LORD for his sin which he hath done: and the sin which he hath done shall be forgiven him.
23: <sup>23</sup> And when ye shall come into the land, and shall have planted all manner of trees for food, then ye shall count the fruit thereof as uncircumcised: three years shall it be as uncircumcised unto you: it shall not be eaten of.
24: <sup>24</sup> But in the fourth year all the fruit thereof shall be holy to praise the LORD withal.
25: <sup>25</sup> And in the fifth year shall ye eat of the fruit thereof, that it may yield unto you the increase thereof: I am the LORD your God.
26: <sup>26</sup> Ye shall not eat any thing with the blood: neither shall ye use enchantment, nor observe times.
27: <sup>27</sup> Ye shall not round the corners of your heads, neither shalt thou mar the corners of thy beard.
28: <sup>28</sup> Ye shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor print any marks upon you: I am the LORD.
29: <sup>29</sup> Do not prostitute thy daughter, to cause her to be a whore; lest the land fall to whoredom, and the land become full of wickedness.
30: <sup>30</sup> Ye shall keep my sabbaths, and reverence my sanctuary: I am the LORD.
31: <sup>31</sup> Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.
32: <sup>32</sup> Thou shalt rise up before the hoary head, and honour the face of the old man, and fear thy God: I am the LORD.
33: <sup>33</sup> And if a stranger sojourn with thee in your land, ye shall not vex him.
34: <sup>34</sup> But the stranger that dwelleth with you shall be unto you as one born among you, and thou shalt love him as thyself; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
35: <sup>35</sup> Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment, in meteyard, in weight, or in measure.
36: <sup>36</sup> Just balances, just weights, a just ephah, and a just hin, shall ye have: I am the LORD your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt.
37: <sup>37</sup> Therefore shall ye observe all my statutes, and all my judgments, and do them: I am the LORD.
